places.name: Museum of Mexican Music
places.perex: Off the beaten path museum where you will learn everything about music, particularly Mexican. Make an appointment here.

places.name: Church of San Antonio
places.perex: Spectacular church that seems to exist in time that's entirely different from your own. Exquisite stonework and details.

places.name: La Casa de los Sabores
places.perex: Longing to pick up Mexican culinary art? Spend an afternoon at this cooking school to learn how to cook the local delicacies.

places.name: Convento de San Francisco de Asís
Santa Rosa Wall
places.perex: An amazing reef which lives its own life. Dive here and marvel at colourful fish and amazing coral formations.

places.name: Las Estacas Natural Water Park
places.perex: What an unusual park - situated by the river, making the best of its freshness and beautiful natural surroundings. A paradise!

places.name: Lac de Pátzcuaro
places.perex: Le lac de Pátzcuaro est un lac du Mexique situé dans les municipalités de Pátzcuaro, Erongarícuaro, Quiroga et Tzintzuntzan, dans l'État de…

places.name: Guerrero Park
places.perex: Visit this beautiful park, a former part of Santa Clara Convent, where you can find a fountain and a statue of Vicente Guerrero.

places.name: Santa Ana Quarter
places.perex: Stroll through this charmingly beautiful district which boasts two historic churches, a lovely park and streets with colorful houses.

places.name: Santa Prisca de Taxco
places.perex: The Parroquia de Santa Prisca y San Sebastían, commonly known as the Church of Santa Prisca, is a colonial monument located in the city of…

places.name: Hacienda Antigua Tequila Tour
places.perex: In this mansion, you will get to know everything about tequila and its production process. Afterwards, you can buy some in the local shop.

places.name: Matatlan
places.perex: Santiago Matatlán a.k.a. "World Capital Of Mezcal" is a town and municipality in Oaxaca in south-western Mexico.

places.name: El Hoyo
places.perex: This disco/bar is also known as the Wonder Hole of Mérida. Enjoy the DJ nights, concerts and taste their cocktails.

places.name: Jade Museum
places.name_suffix: San Cristóbal de Las Casas, Mexique
places.perex: If admiring replicas is enough for you, then a visit to this museum can definitely be recommended.

places.name: Galeria Azul
places.perex: Various original handmade artworks are on display in this gallery. See traditional Mexican art and buy a nice souvenir!

places.name: La Gruta
places.perex: Enjoy a wonderfully relaxing day in these hot springs. Pools of different temperatures, caves, chill out areas - ultimate spa experience.

places.name: San Fernando Square
places.perex: Take a walk through San Fernando plaza and you will notice lively cafés, colourful shops, majestic churches and dozens of historic museums.

places.name: Rotonda de los Jaliscenses Ilustres
places.perex: The state's "hall of fame", there are 20 bronze sculptures of popular writers, composers, architects and revolutionaries on the plaza.

places.name: Flora's Field Kitchen
places.perex: A peaceful restaurant tucked away from the resorts. Serves delicious organic meals that will energize you.

places.name: Ultrafreeze Wreck
places.perex: Explore the sunken tugboat that is now fully accommodated with underwater life. The visibility is usually very good.

places.name: Flea Market
places.perex: Bargaining is the norm here, so  step up, find something you fancy and try to get the best price. Great for souvenirs.

places.name: Yal Ku Lagoon
places.perex: Rather organised yet still a wonderful spot for snorkeling. Abundance of colourful sea life and so many other things to do.

places.name: El Bajo
places.perex: Marisla Seamount, also known as "El Bajo", is located about 8 miles north-northeast of La Paz, Mexico.

places.name: Basílica de Zapopan
places.perex: The basilica which was built in 1730 is the pride of Zapopan and houses a statue of Virgin Mary that is always being visited by pilgrims.

places.name: Old Town
places.perex: The core of Taxco is a showcase of colonial architecture. Just loosely wander around and look up at all the beautiful houses.

places.name: Panama Jack Resorts Gran Porto Playa del Carmen
Corona Beach
places.perex: Belonging to the most beautiful beaches on Cozumel, this one is particularly known for its abundant underwater life.

places.name: Punta Molas Lighthouse
places.perex: Located on the northernmost tip of Cozumel, this lighthouse is a good viewing point. You'll see all the beauty of the surrounding sceneries.

places.name: Arena Coliseo
places.perex: A memorable night for anyone enjoying wrestling. Come admire the feats of masked luchadores fighting each other.

places.name: Labna Ha
places.perex: Not your typical cenote experience. This adventure is perfect for families with small kids and those who wish to avoid crowds.

places.name: Plaza Tapatia
places.perex: A popular seven-block-long square you do not want to miss, the Plaza is very popular by locals and tourists alike.

places.name: Puerto Morelos Beach
places.perex: Undeveloped, white sand beach running all the way along the fishing village. Somehow off the beaten track - well worth it.

places.name: Tlaquepaque District
places.perex: A fashionable colonial neighbourhood is nowadays a trendy boutique shopping district very popular with tourists. Explore the local treasures!

places.name: Pik Nik
places.perex: This restaurant is mostly visited by the local regulars. No wonder - the food is very authentic and the prices reasonable.

places.name: Plaza de la Liberación
places.perex: Situated in the heart of the historic district, the permanently busy plaza is flocked by students, couples and even corporate employees.

places.name: La Pastora Zoo Park
places.perex: This little yet beloved zoo is interestingly divided into four zones so that the visitors can enjoy different environments.

places.name: Selva Mágica
places.perex: This stunning amusement park finds itself near the Guadalajara zoo and has over 30 attractions and rides available to the visitors.

places.name: Ex-convento de Santo Domingo de Guzmán
Mercado de San Juan Ernesto Pugibet
Marina Vallarta
places.perex: This marina is full of shops and restaurants, it is a perfect place for an evening dinner. The view of bay full of ships is amazing.

places.name: Papagayo Park
places.perex: An awesome park filled with greenery and attractions - three lakes, a playground, soccer field and more. Fun afternoon out.

places.name: Ángela Peralta Theater
places.perex: This theater is very popular. It is a venue for various performances such as opera, theater plays or concerts,

places.name: Diego Rivera Mosaic Mural
places.perex: One of the final artworks of the famous artist. It depicts Quetzalcoatl and is made of seashells and other materials.

places.name: Pedro Infante Monument
places.perex: A sculpture of famous Mexican actor Pedro Infante riding a motorbike. He was and he still is very popular in Mexico.

places.name: Peón Contreras Theatre
places.perex: The oldest and most poetic theater in the city stages both international and national plays - something for everyone.

places.name: Kool
places.perex: This beach club is always busy and full of excitement. Have a fresh drink with a view of the beach or party well into the night.

places.name: Nikki Beach
places.perex: A luxurious establishment best known for its world-class parties. Order a drink and let the atmosphere engulf you.

places.name: Pie in the Sky Restaurant
places.perex: If you have sweet tooth, this place will satisfy you, it is considered to be the best bakery in Puerto, your kids will love this place.

places.name: Brujas Beach
places.perex: A beach located north of Mazatlán. It is great for surfers, it is also not so overcrowded as beaches closer to the city.

places.name: Puerto Aventuras Beaches
places.perex: The finest sand beaches on River Maya draw tourist flocks from the whole world. Lively resorts full of fun.

places.name: Acapulco Princess Golf Course
places.perex: The Hotel Princess Mundo Imperial is a resort hotel located in Acapulco, Guerrero, Mexico.

places.name: Puerto Marques Bay
places.perex: A breath-taking bay and the perfect spot for any water activities. The restaurants here are great, too.

places.name: Caleta Beaches
places.perex: Acapulco's traditional beach loved even by Hollywood stars. Calm water, lots of facilities and entertainment for the whole day.

places.name: El Squid Roe
places.perex: A harbour-side nightclub where the party never stops. Four levels of fun and the top floor is open-air so you can cool down a little.

places.name: Garash Gallery
places.perex: Contemporary art from Mexico, Japan and other countries can be found here. Temporary exhibitions only.

places.name: Guadalajara Regional Museum
places.perex: An amazing collection of the history of western Mexico divided into multiple sections is a must visit for anyone wanting to learn.

places.name: Basilica of Our Lady of Health
places.perex: Visit this unique yet unfinished cathedral dating back to the 16th century and admire the beauty of its interior.

places.name: National Museum of Death
places.perex: Being focused on both murky and fascinating objects, this museum belongs to the most visited ones in the city.

places.name: La Madera Beach
places.perex: This small beach is covered with dark sand and is a good place for surfing. The sea breeze will refresh you here.

places.name: Ex Convento Franciscano
places.perex: Not only is this 16th century monastery an interesting sight, it also offers a great view of the town and surrounding mountains.

places.name: Yucatan Children's Cultural Center
places.perex: Nice and interactive center which offers various courses and workshops for children ranging from music to arts, dance and acting.

places.name: Área Natural Protegida Bosque de Tlalpan
El Cedazo Park
places.perex: The vast park recently built around the reservoir is a popular relaxation zone for the locals. You'll enjoy a walk here, too.

places.name: Vineyard Los Rosales
places.perex: Explore this vineyard established in 1970, witness the traditional process of winemaking, taste some organic wines and buy souvenirs.

places.name: La Bocana
places.perex: Established in 1965, this traditional Mexican restaurant is one of the best in the area. Have a dinner or a cocktail here.

places.name: Cultural Institute Oaxaca
places.perex: Apart from long-term language courses, this center offers a variety of workshops that will introduce you to Mexican culture.

places.name: Pueblos Mancomunados
places.perex: The complex of hiking trails leading through thick woods connects eight villages seemingly "at the end of the world". A wonderful experience.

places.name: El Fuerte
places.perex: El Fuerte is a city and its surrounding municipality in the northwestern Mexican state of Sinaloa.

places.name: Museum of Natural History
places.perex: Newly renovated museum which presents the history of the local fauna and flora in an intriguing way. Great programs for the small ones.

places.name: Lac de Chapala
places.perex: Le lac de Chapala est le troisième plus grand lac d'Amérique latine et le plus étendu du Mexique avec une superficie de 1 100 km².

places.name: Museum-Workshop Erasto Cortés
places.perex: Discover the most amazing pieces of art made by Erasto Cortéz, a 20th century Mexican painter and sculptor.

places.name: Pedro Coronel Museum
places.perex: For all fans of art there is a museum with Pedro Coronelonó's paintings and as well as with a collection of modern European art.

places.name: Isla Arena Lighthouse
places.perex: Part of the Celestún Nature Preserve, this lighthouse not only navigates ships but also offers a panoramic view of the sea.

places.name: Aguascalientes Cathedral
places.perex: The Cathedral Basilica of Our Lady of the Assumption Also Aguascalientes Cathedral It is the main Catholic building of the city of…

places.name: Galeria Fotografica Vicente Kramsky
places.name_suffix: San Cristóbal de Las Casas, Mexique
places.perex: Visit this small yet interesting institute dedicated to the life and work of an innovative local photographer and cave explorer.

places.name: Felipe Xicotencatl Shipwreck
places.perex: USS Scuffle was an Admirable-class minesweeper built for the United States Navy during World War II.

places.name: Callejon del Romance
places.perex: A narrow street full of flowers, where you can sit on a nearby fountain, read poems or chat with your darling. A popular lovers' place.

places.name: Puente de la Historia
places.perex: Admire the bridge, a popular tourist attraction, which is a part of Camino Real de Tierra Adentro World Heritage Site.

places.name: Museum of Textiles
places.name_suffix: San Cristóbal de Las Casas, Mexique
places.perex: Museo de Trajes Regionales is located in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, Mexico.

places.name: Cocoa Eco-Museum
places.perex: If you are interested in the Mayan civilization and its relation to cocoa, then visit this intriguing museum. Experience Mayan ceremonies!

places.name: Patio Mexica Cooking School
places.perex: Those who like to learn new things on their holidays can visit this cooking school and prepare tasty Mexican dishes.

places.name: Paseo San Francisco
places.perex: The historical buildings of central Puebla have been restored and a commercial area has been formed here.

places.name: Cerro de Fortín
places.perex: Climb up to this hill to overlook the city - this is the best vantage point in Oaxaca. Avoid it after sunset for security reasons, though.
